net.dragondelve.customdriversutil.gui.editor

Class VehicleClassLibraryEditor

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.dragondelve.customdriversutil.gui.editor.VehicleClassLibraryEditor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Editor<VehicleClass>, StageController

    public class VehicleClassLibraryEditor
extends java.lang.Object
implements Editor<VehicleClass>
    Editor that can edit a VehicleLibrary's List of VehicleClass. Allows the user to create new instances of VehicleClass, remove tracks from the list and to edit each item on the list. The Editor should be displayed on a separate decorated stage as there is no way to close the stage from inside the editor.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private javafx.scene.control.Button addLiveryNameButton
      Button that adds a new LiveryName to a VehicleClass this button performs addLiveryNameAction on action.
      private javafx.scene.control.Button addVehicleClassButton
      Button that adds a new VehicleClass to a VehicleClassLibrary.
      private boolean controlsAreDisabled
      Flag that determines if the controls are currently being disabled.
      private javafx.scene.control.CheckBox isModdedCheckBox
      CheckBox that displays and allows the user to edit the isModded flag of the vehicle class that determines if it's a modded vehicle class or a vanilla vehicle class.
      private javafx.collections.ObservableList<VehicleClass> items
      An observable list of items that are being edited by this editor.
      private javafx.scene.control.ListView<java.lang.String> liveryNameListView
      List View that shows the list of all livery names assigned to a VehicleClass selected in the vehicleClassTableView.
      private javafx.scene.control.Button removeLiveryNameButton
      Button that removes a liveryName that is selected in liveryNameListView.
      private javafx.scene.control.Button removeVehicleClassButton
      Button that removes the vehicleClass selected in the vehicleClassTableView.This button performs removeVehicleClass action on action.
      private javafx.scene.control.SplitPane rootPane
      Root pane of this editor.
      private javafx.stage.Stage stage
      Stage on which this editor is displayed.
      private javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<VehicleClass,java.lang.String> vehicleClassNameTableColumn
      TableColumn that is a part of VehicleClassTableView that displays the human-readable name for the vehicle class.
      private javafx.scene.control.TextField vehicleClassNameTextField
      TextField that allows the user to edit the name of the vehicle class that is currently selected in the vehicleClassTableView.
      private javafx.scene.control.TableView<VehicleClass> vehicleClassTableView
      TableView that displays the list of vehicleClasses that are currently edited.
      private javafx.scene.control.TextField vehicleClassXMLNameTextField
      TextField that displays and allows the user to edit the name of the vehicle class selected in the vehicleClassTableView that is going to be used as a default filename when saving the xml file.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Initialize method initializes all the visual elements before they are displayed by the user. initialize method is called automatically by JavaFX when this editor is being loaded from XML.

      • setStage

        public void setStage(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
        Lightweight mutator method. Should be called before the editor is initialized by JavaFX.
        Specified by:
        setStage in interface StageController
        Parameters:
        stage - stage on which this editor is going to be displayed.

      • getItems

        public javafx.collections.ObservableList<VehicleClass> getItems()
        Lightweight accessor method.
        Specified by:
        getItems in interface Editor<VehicleClass>
        Returns:
        Observable list of Vehicle Classes that are edited by this editor.

      • setItems

        public void setItems(javafx.collections.ObservableList<VehicleClass> items)
        Lightweight mutator method. Should be called before initialize method is called by the JavaFX.
        Specified by:
        setItems in interface Editor<VehicleClass>
        Parameters:
        items - Observable list of Vehicle Classes that are edited by this editor.

      • addVehicleClassAction

        private void addVehicleClassAction()
        Creates a new VehicleClass in the vehicleClassLibrary. The name of the class is set to New Class and the xmlName is set to New class as well.

      • removeVehicleClassAction

        private void removeVehicleClassAction()
        Removes a vehicle class currently selected in the vehicleClassTableView. if a selection is empty it will return. If the vehicleClass selected is the last in the list it will select the previous item in the tableView. If the selectedVehicleClass is not the last one in the list it will instead select the next one in the list.

      • addLiveryNameAction

        private void addLiveryNameAction()
        Adds a new livery name to the vehicleClass currently selected in the TableView. The name of the livery is set to New Livery.

      • removeLiveryNameAction

        private void removeLiveryNameAction()
        of an item is selected in the liveryNameListView it removes the selected item. If the item removed was the last item of the list it will attempt to select the previous item. If it is not the last it will select the next item instead.

      • setDisableControls

        private void setDisableControls(boolean disable)
        Method used to disable all editing controls if no selection in the tableView is made.
        Parameters:
        disable - True if you want to disable all controls, false if you want to enable them.

      • bindVehicleClass

        private void bindVehicleClass(VehicleClass vehicleClass)
        Method that binds properties of a given vehicleClass to the controls to allow user to edit them. The bind is bidirectional and should be unbound with unbindVehicleClass when it's no longer needed.
        Parameters:
        vehicleClass - Vehicle Class whose properties are to be bound to the controls

      • unbindVehicleCLass

        private void unbindVehicleCLass(VehicleClass vehicleClass)
        Method that unbinds properties of a given vehicleClass from the control. If a vehicleClass is bound with bindVehicleClass it should be unbound with unbindVehicleClass when it's no longer needed.
        Parameters:
        vehicleClass - Vehicle Class whose properties are to be bound to the controls
